required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Safety and Early Efficacy Study of TBX-2400 in Patients With AML or Myelofibrosis
clinical_study.official_title: A Phase I Study to Assess the Safety and Early Efficacy of TBX-2400 in Enhancing Engraftment in Patients Undergoing Allogeneic Hematopoietic Stem Cell Transplant for the Treatment of Acute Myelogenous Leukemia or Myelofibrosis

brief_summary.textblock:
This is a study of allogeneic stem cell transplantation with TBX-2400 in adult subjects with Acute Myelogenous Leukemia (AML) or Myelofibrosis (MF).
The donor cells are exposed to a protein that has been shown in the laboratory to improve the ability of the donor cells to make blood and immune cells after transplant. Exposure of the donor cells to this protein does not modify the genes in the cells in any way.
This study has two goals. The first goal is to find out if transplant with TBX-2400 is safe. The second goal is to find out what effects TBX-2400 stem cells have on time to engraftment in adult subjects with AML or MF.
The study hypothesis is that TBX-2400 cells will shorten the time to immune reconstitution after transplant.

primary_outcome.measure: Incidence of adverse events according to NCI-CTCAE Version 5.0
primary_outcome.description: Adverse events from subject reporting or other assessments
Assessment of transplant engraftment will include absolute neutrophil count, untransfused platelet count and donor chimerism

secondary_outcome.measure: Immune reconstitution as measured by CD3+ cell count
secondary_outcome.description: Immune reconstitution as measured by CD3+ cell count > 300/μL
CD45 RA versus RO at 3, 6, 9 and 12 months

secondary_outcome.measure: Quality of life using the World Health Organisation Five Wellbeing Index
secondary_outcome.description: QoL assessed at 3, 6, 9 and 12 months (World Health Organization [WHO] Five Wellbeing Index).

overall_official.affiliation: Unit for Hematology and BMT, Fondazione Policlinico Universitario Agostino Gemelli, Rome, Italy
